description: Parse HTML character references: fast, spec-compliant, positional information
name: parse-entities
readme:
# parse-entities [![Build Status][build-badge]][build-status] [![Coverage Status][coverage-badge]][coverage-status]

Parse HTML character references: fast, spec-compliant, positional
information.

## Installation

[npm][]:

```bash
npm install parse-entities
```

## Usage

```js
var decode = require('parse-entities');

decode('alpha &amp bravo');
// alpha & bravo

decode('charlie ©cat; delta');
// charlie Â©cat; delta

decode('echo © foxtrot ≠ golf 𝌆 hotel');
// echo Â© foxtrot â‰  golf ðŒ† hotel
```

## API

## `parseEntities(value[, options])`

###### `options`

*   `additional` (`string`, optional, default: `''`)
    â€” Additional character to accept when following an ampersand (without
    error);
*   `attribute` (`boolean`, optional, default: `false`)
    â€” Whether to parse `value` as an attribute value;
*   `nonTerminated` (`boolean`, default: `true`)
    â€” Whether to allow non-terminated entities, such as `&copycat` to
    `Â©cat`.  This behaviour is spec-compliant but can lead to unexpected
    results;
*   `warning` ([`Function`][warning], optional)
    â€” Error handler;
*   `text` ([`Function`][text], optional)
    â€” Text handler;
*   `reference` ([`Function`][reference],
    optional) â€” Reference handler;
*   `warningContext` (`'*'`, optional)
    â€” Context used when invoking `warning`;
*   `textContext` (`'*'`, optional)
    â€” Context used when invoking `text`;
*   `referenceContext` (`'*'`, optional)
    â€” Context used when invoking `reference`;
*   `position` (`Location` or `Position`, optional)
    â€” Starting `position` of `value`, useful when dealing with values
    nested in some sort of syntax tree. The default is:

    ```json
    {
      "start": {
        "line": 1,
        "column": 1,
        "offset": 0
      },
      "indent": []
    }
    ```

###### Returns

`string` â€” Decoded `value`.

### `function warning(reason, position, code)`

Error handler.

###### Context

`this` refers to `warningContext` when given to `parseEntities`.

###### Parameters

*   `reason` (`string`)
    â€” Reason (human-readable) for triggering a parse error;
*   `position` (`Position`)
    â€” Place at which the parse error occurred;
*   `code` (`number`)
    â€” Identifier of reason for triggering a parse error.

The following codes are used:

| Code | Example            | Note                                          |
| ---- | ------------------ | --------------------------------------------- |
| `1`  | `foo &amp bar`     | Missing semicolon (named)                     |
| `2`  | `foo &#123 bar`    | Missing semicolon (numeric)                   |
| `3`  | `Foo &bar baz`     | Ampersand did not start a reference           |
| `4`  | `Foo &#`           | Empty reference                               |
| `5`  | `Foo &bar; baz`    | Unknown entity                                |
| `6`  | `Foo € baz`   | [Disallowed reference][invalid]               |
| `7`  | `Foo � baz` | Prohibited: outside permissible unicode range |

###### `function text(value, location)`

Text handler.

###### Context

`this` refers to `textContext` when given to `parseEntities`.

###### Parameters

*   `value` (`string`) â€” String of content;
*   `location` (`Location`) â€” Location at which `value` starts and ends.

### `function reference(value, location, source)`

Character reference handler.

###### Context

`this` refers to `referenceContext` when given to `parseEntities`.

###### Parameters

*   `value` (`string`) â€” Encoded character reference;
*   `location` (`Location`) â€” Location at which `value` starts and ends;
*   `source` (`Location`) â€” Source of character reference.
